subtitle: In this video, we're going to examine
some of the implications of the golden
rectangle that we drew in the previous
video. So to begin with, I'm going to
open up my library browser and bring in
the basic layer set.
And I'm also going to switch to "My
Drawings" subfolder.
I just drew that golden rectangle.
I'm going to bring that in here as well.
Then I'll type ZA for zoom all, so I can
get a close look at this.
This comes in with the other geometry,
the dimensions and so on.
And I'm not really concerned about that
now. But I would like to start this
project off by rotating this golden
rectangle 90 degrees.
So I'm just going to do that here.
I'd like to rotate it 90 degrees,
deleting the original.
So from this golden rectangle, I'm going
to construct a circle.
And I'm going to place that on, let's
say, layer "4 Green."
I'll make a circle centered down here in
the corner and its radius is going to
match up with this division here in the
golden rectangle. And so this should come
in as a unit circle with a radius of 1.
All right, great. Now I'm going to draw
in a line and actually, this is going to
be an infinite line, and it's going to
start at the reference point at the
bottom of the circle and it will run,
with ortho mode on, it'll run
horizontally. So I click a point over
here and then right click to stop drawing
the line. I'll turn off ortho.
Then I'll draw another line.
But this time it'll just be a line
segment and it's going to start at the
top of the golden rectangle.
And it's going to be tangent to the
circle. So I want to make sure that we
see that there.
Then I'll draw another line matching on
the other side tangent.
Now, I'd like to join these two lines
together with the infinite line.
So I'll use Corner Sharp.
Click on these two pairs of objects to
join them together. So this is no longer
an infinite line, it's just a segment.
I'll turn on my gray layer.
And I'll set that current.
And then I'd like to dimension the angle
of this triangle that I've drawn here.
That comes in but the scale is too large
here, so I just need to make an
adjustment to the drawing preferences and
make this drawing have a scale factor of
0.5, and OK.
So it's really amazing to me is that this
is the Great Pyramid's slope angle.
And it's very accurate.
So this perhaps exposes how the ancient
Egyptians were constructing this monument
using the golden ratio.
But there's more.
There's far more. And let me show you
that. I'm just going to select that.
And notice, how it has these gray lines
that go off? I'm going to get rid of
those by exploding that dimension.
Now I'll turn off the green layer.
You can see them a little better and I'll

form "squares the circle."
So to do that, I'm going to choose

So why don't we make it more rational?

That'll give us a way to compare it with

divided by 8.
We're 99.9%
